meanings.definition: A young man who is arrogant or conceited.
meanings.sent1: The princock strutted around the party, thinking he was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends couldn't stand the new guy's attitude; he was a real princock.
meanings.sent3: The princock insisted on having the best seat at the table, much to everyone's annoyance.
meanings.sent4: His behavior at the meeting was like that of a princock, always interrupting and talking over others.
meanings.sent5: The princock's haughty demeanor made him quite unpopular among his peers.

meanings.definition: To behave in a conceited or arrogant manner.
meanings.sent1: He would often princock around the office, acting as if he was the boss.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to princock in front of her friends, so she tried to be more humble.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to princock after catching a mouse, strutting around proudly with its tail up.
meanings.sent4: The politician continued to princock despite the public's disapproval, refusing to listen to criticism.
meanings.sent5: As he won the game, he couldn't help but princock a little, showing off his victory.
